body.p:
To His Excelency
Beriah Magoffin Gov. of Ky,

Your petitioners would most Repsectfully and urgently recommend the Releice of John W Cornelius from two Bonds as Surety for John A Taylor to the Commonwealth, in the Christian Circuit Court, one for two hundred dollars for Gaiming; the other for Sixty dollars for Keeping a Tipling house: Said Cornelius has ever been a good and orderly and Law abiding citizen: he was a neighbor of said Taylor and was induced to go on his Bonds for his appearance at the next term of the Court; and a Band of men styling themselves regulators, drove the said Taylor off from the County before the said next term of the said Court: Thereby preventing him from appearing in discharge of his said Bonds; whilst your petitioners would say nothing as between Taylor and the Commonwealth, they would strongly recomend the cancelling of the Bonds So far as John W Cornelius is concerned we think it a case worthy of Executive clemency

S, M, Bernard
W, S, Dabney
John Feland
D M Claggett
Tho. S. Bryan
Joe. Clark
J. W. A. McGarvey
Jno B Gowen S c c

Remitted
no Judgment
B. M
Cornelius -- for future -- Bond
